Missing points? Or just checking? If just checking  the CSOs usually have a very good chance of giving wrong info.Better off checking onheymax.aior empty amaze wallet.

Hi everyone!I need some advice on which credit card to use for a Shopee purchase. I'm looking at getting a camera for around $3k. I've got the HSBC Revolution  Citi Rewards  OCBC 365  and UOB Lady's Card.I’m leaning more towards earning miles than cashback.Which card do you think works best for this? Thanks for your help!
They are not always right. A lot of time they don’t know what they are saying
This cso talking nonsense. Cut her off. Try another cso
More like always not right 🤡
Empty amaze wallet won’t tell if Agoda is under Travel category for UOB Lady’s 😅
That's the bank's own rules. MAS regulation does not require.
True but you can check mcc and description. Will roughly tell you if will be counted or not.Heymax.aiis the easiest way.
Have you triedheymax.ai? It's a great tool to find out what's the best card or cards eligible for your spend.
For example  I know from ML which things under Travel. But if you refer to TnC  there’s no info about which MCCs are under Travel.Heymax yes  but not empty amaze wallet
Yup  they only provide a vague description. That's why best to check againstheymax.ai.
Still empty amaze wallet is useless for checking if it’s under Travel
the cso is saying mcc 4722:  travel agency is not under travel  lol.
You can get MCC and check against other merchants with the same MCC onheymax.ai  if it somehow doesn't exist in their database. Not entirely useless.
Most of the time we use amaze + empty wallet. Get the mcc to be 4772 or 7011 and we know it’s safe for Travel (pun intended)
Heymax.aistates 4722 as well. Unlessheymax.aiis not accurate anymore. 🤡

5309 is also under travel. But again  Amaze will give you MCC  but won’t tell you if it’s under Travel Category for UOB Lady’s. Even TnC of UOB Lady’s won’t tell you that. You need more tools and sources (or test and see)
yea  the issue here is a cso giving rubbish answer. Anyway knowing the mcc or being listed in heymax does not help justify whether uob give bonus points or not.
He isn’t making a statement  “lol” refers to smth else 😂

Guys  do you buy travel insurance if your credit card already have complimentary insurance? I use the hsbc revolution card to book my flight so is it advisable to buy a travel insurance?
The coverage offered by credit card tends to be quite minimal  you might want to look at what's offered by your card first

https://www.hsbc.com.sg/content/dam/hsbc/sg/documents/credit-cards/revolution/travel-insurance.pdfAssuming this is the one that you're looking at  I will say... some things like Medical expenses and maybe definition of "Loss of luggage" could differ. Try reading the terms abit and u will see what i mean

End of day  travel insurance (at least to me) is to get peace of mind. If the free one can covers what you think is sufficient then go ahead.. if not  purchase one so u won't travel with a worried mind :)
